--- title: "2-ecommerce-linear-reg" code-fold: true --- :::{.callout-note,title="ç®€ä»‹"} > é€šè¿‡ä¸Šç½‘æµè§ˆæ—¶é—´é¢„æµ‹å¹´èŠ±è´¹ 1. dataset: [`kaggle ecommerce dataset`](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kolawale/focusing-on-mobile-app-or-website) 2. [model](https://www.kaggle.com/code/mohammedibrahim784/e-commerce-dataset-linear-regression-model) 3. using `MLJLinearModels.jl` [ðŸ”—](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/MLJLinearModels.jl) ::: ## 1. load package ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} import MLJ:predict using GLMakie, MLJ,CSV,DataFrames,StatsBase ``` ::: ## 2. process data ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.julia .cell-code code-fold="show"} str="Ecommerce-Customers" df=CSV.File("./data/Ecommerce-Customers.csv") |> DataFrame |> dropmissing; select!(df,4:8) X=df[:,1:4]|>Matrix|>MLJ.table y=Vector(df[:,5]) first(df,5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=84} ```{=html}
5Ã—5 DataFrame

``` ::: ::: ## 3. plot corrleation of variables ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.julia .cell-code} axs = [] label=names(df)|>Array colors = [:orange, :lightgreen, :purple,:lightblue,:red,:green] fig = Figure(resolution=(1400, 1400)) ax=Axis(fig[1,1]) function plot_diag(i) ax = Axis(fig[i, i]) push!(axs, ax) density!(ax, df[:, i]; color=(colors[i], 0.5), strokewidth=1.25, strokecolor=colors[i]) end function plot_cor(i, j) ax = Axis(fig[i, j]) scatter!(ax, df[:, i], df[:, j]; color=colors[j]) end function plot_pair() [(i == j ? plot_diag(i) : plot_cor(i, j)) for i in 1:5, j in 1:5] end function add_xy_label() for i in 1:5 Axis(fig[5, i], xlabel=label[i],) Axis(fig[i, 1], ylabel=label[i],) end end function main() plot_pair() add_xy_label() return fig end main() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=85} ![](2-ecommerce-linear-reg_files/figure-html/cell-4-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ## 4. plot pair variables's cov and cor matrix ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df_cov = df|>Matrix|>cov.|> d -> round(d, digits=3) df_cor = df|>Matrix|>cor.|> d -> round(d, digits=3) function plot_cov_cor() fig = Figure(resolution=(2200, 800)) ax1 = Axis(fig[1, 1]; xticks=(1:5, label), yticks=(1:5, label), title="ecommerce cov matrix",yreversed=true) ax3 = Axis(fig[1, 3], xticks=(1:5, label), yticks=(1:5, label), title="ecommerce cor matrix",yreversed=true) hm = heatmap!(ax1, df_cov) Colorbar(fig[1, 2], hm) [text!(ax1, x, y; text=string(df_cov[x, y]), color=:white, fontsize=18, align=(:center, :center)) for x in 1:5, y in 1:5] hm2 = heatmap!(ax3, df_cor) Colorbar(fig[1, 4], hm2) [text!(ax3, x, y; text=string(df_cor[x, y]), color=:white, fontsize=18, align=(:center, :center)) for x in 1:5, y in 1:5] fig end plot_cov_cor() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=86} ![](2-ecommerce-linear-reg_files/figure-html/cell-5-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ## 5. MLJ workflow ### 5.1 load model ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.julia .cell-code} LinearRegressor = @load LinearRegressor pkg=MLJLinearModels model=LinearRegressor() mach = MLJ.fit!(machine(model,X,y)) fitted_params(mach) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` import MLJLinearModels âœ” ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` [ Info: For silent loading, specify `verbosity=0`. [ Info: Training machine(LinearRegressor(fit_intercept = true, â€¦), â€¦). â”Œ Info: Solver: MLJLinearModels.Analytical â”‚ iterative: Bool false â”” max_inner: Int64 200 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=87} ``` (coefs = [:x1 => 25.734271084705085, :x2 => 38.709153810834366, :x3 => 0.43673883559434407, :x4 => 61.57732375487839], intercept = -1051.5942553006273,) ``` ::: ::: ### 5.2 predict ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.julia .cell-code} y_hat =predict(mach, X) "rmsd"=>rmsd(y,y_hat) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=88} ``` "rmsd" => 9.923256785022247 ``` ::: ::: ### 5.3 plot residuals ::: {.cell execution_count=7} ``` {.julia .cell-code} resid=y_hat.=y stem(resid) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=89} ![](2-ecommerce-linear-reg_files/figure-html/cell-8-output-1.png){} ::: :::
